value.name: description
value.value:
The dataset is part of the output of the REPUBLIC-project, which provides access to the handwritten and printed resolutions of the Dutch States General between 1576 and 1796. The resolutions of the States General in the Dutch Republic are a key resource to the political history of this period as they contain all decisions made by the States General (SG), the central ruling body in the Republic. 

The dataset consists of multiple data resources, each containing a specific type of entity that has been extracted from the resolutions. The motivation of creating the data set is to facilitate searches to the entities within the resolutions. The entity types are:

-committees (COM)
-dates (DAT)
-roles (HOE)
-locations (LOC)
-organisations (ORG)
-persons (PER)

Per entity type, except for dates, there is a resource that contains the sections of text detected as referring to this entity type (e.g. annotations-layer_PER), a resource that contains a list of the standardized entities produced by curating these sections of text (e.g. PER entities), and a resource containing the occurrences of these entities in the text of the resolutions (e.g. PER annotations). The entity type 'dates' does not have a list of standardised entities associated with it.

value.name: additionalNotes
value.value: The temporal coverage refers to the resolutions from which the entities are extracted.

value.name: citationInformation
value.value: Dijkstra, G., Groskamp, N., Hoekstra, R., Koolen, M., Renkema, E., Sluijter, R., Smit, F., & Oddens, J. (2024). Entities recognised in the resolutions of the States General of the Dutch Republic (1576-1796) [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14577244

value.name: Description
value.value:
Through an automated process, nearly two million text elements in the resolutions were identified as personal names. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_PER' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same name were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'PER-annotations' (see below). The PER-entities data resource described here contains the standardized surnames to which the 'PER-annotations' data resource refers. The over 8,000 names in this resource together account for about half of the name mentions appearing in the resolutions. The remaining name mentions concern names that appear only once or a few times. These are not part of this dataset.
For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

value.name: descriptionField
value.value:
The identification number of the person entities in the data
resource.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The standardised surname of the person entities in the data resource.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The entity category 'PER' to indicate this is a person-entity.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field is always empty in this data resource. In the other entity data resources, it serves as a broad category for grouping entities, but that does not apply here.

value.name: Description
value.value:
Through an automated process, almost 140,000 text elements in the resolutions were identified as committees. Committees consisted of a number of delegates to the States General to handle specific matters. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_COM' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same committee were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'COM-annotations' (see below). The COM-entities data resource described here contains the standardized committee names to which the 'COM-annotations' data resource refers. 
For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The identification number of the committee entities in the data resource.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The standardised name of the committee in modern Dutch spelling.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The entity category 'COM' to indicate these are committee-entities.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The labels indicate the broader category or categories in which the committees have been classified by the compilers. We did this to make it possible for users to select committees of a certain type.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field provides additional information for certain committees.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field is always empty in this data resource. In the other entity data resources, it may contain links to external datasets.

value.name: Description
value.value:
Through an automated process, more than two million text elements in the resolutions were identified as 'role'-entities. A role can be an occupation (e.g. carpenter), an office (e.g. burgomaster), a judicial status (e.g. widow) et cetera. These role designations are typically found in the resolutions near the names of individuals. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_HOE' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same name were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'HOE-annotations' (see below). The HOE-entities data resource described here contains the standardized roles to which the 'HOE-annotations' data resource refers. 
For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The identification number of the role entities in the data resource.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The standardised name of the role in modern Dutch spelling.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The entity category 'HOE' to indicate these are role entities.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The labels indicate the broader category or categories in which the roles have been classified by the compilers. We did this to make it possible for users to select roles of a certain type.

value.name: Description
value.value:
The data resource contains location-entities whose occurrences are mentioned in the text of the resolutions.
Through an automated process, more than two million text elements in the resolutions were identified as locations. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_LOC' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same location were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'LOC-annotations' (see below). The LOC-entities data resource described here contains the standardized location names to which the 'LOC-annotations' data resource refers. This resource contains all (found) locations that appear more than once in the resolutions and is therefore fairly complete: an identified location was assigned to more than 90% of the text elements that were recognised as a location reference. Text elements where this was not possible were omitted from this dataset.
For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The identification number of the location entities in the data resource.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The standardised name of the location in modern Dutch spelling.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field contains a link to the GeoNames identification number, if available.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The name of the larger geographical unit of which the location is a part (mainly continents).

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The name of the present-day country in which the entity is located.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The geographic coordinates of the location.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field contains standardised additional designations in modern Dutch spelling such as 'dorp'(village), 'rivier' (river), or 'hertogdom' (duchy) that occasionally accompany the names of locations in the text of the resolutions. This allows users to find all locations at once that were referred to by the States General itself as, for example, village, river, or duchy.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The name of the present-day province in the Netherlands in which the location is situated, if applicable.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field contains name variants of the locations if they are more significant than spelling variations.

value.name: Description
value.value:
Through an automated process, nearly 600,000 text elements in the resolutions were identified as organisations. 'Organisation' refers to an official or less official association of individuals that the compilers have considered as an organisation, e.g. a government agency, a military unit, or a religious institution. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_ORG' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the organisation were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'ORG-annotations' (see below). The ORG-entities data resource described here contains the standardized organisation names to which the 'ORG-annotations' data resource refers. Approximately 80% of the text elements that refer to some form of organisation could be identified as a known organisation. The remainder that could not be identified was not included in this dataset.
For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The identification number of the organisation entities in the data resource.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The standardised name of the organisation in modern Dutch spelling.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The entity category 'ORG' to indicate these are organisation entities.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The labels indicate the broader category or categories in which the organisations have been classified by the compilers. This includes thematic, geographic as well as chronological categories. We did this to make it possible for users to select organisations of a certain type, and/or active in a certain region and/or time frame.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field is always empty in this data resource.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: This field contains references to the corresponding locations in the LOC-entities data resource in the case of local governments.

value.name: Description
value.value:
This data resource contains the occurrences of the person-entities in the text of the resolutions. It contains an identification number that refers to the standardised form in the PER-entities data resource (see above).
For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The identification number of the person entities in the data resource, corresponding to the identification number in the data resource 'PER-entities'.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The reference to the exact location of the entity-occurrence in the machine readable text of the resolutions.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: A reference to where, when, how and why the entity-occurrence is extracted.

value.name: description
errordescription
value.value: The entity extraction was performed through an automated process. Therefore, errors may occur. Due to the size of the data, these errors could not be corrected manually.

value.name: description
value.value: Occurrences of entities have been automatically annotated in the text of the resolutions.

value.name: specify
value.value: The resource contains derogatory terms for, for example, people of color. This is because the texts originate from the period 1576-1796. In the data resource with standardized terms (PER-entities), these terms have been replaced with neutral terms that were commonly used at the time of the creation of the data resource.

value.name: knownBiases
value.value: See above; the resource contains derogatory terms for certain population groups. This is because the text reflects the views that prevailed at the time the resolutions were written.

value.name: stepsToReduceBias
value.value: In the data resource with standardized terms (PER-entities), derogatory terms have been replaced with neutral terms that were commonly used at the time of the creation of the data resource.

value.name: specify
value.value: See above: the data resource contains information about, for example, race or ethnicity, but not about individuals who are alive today..

value.name: Description
value.value:
Through an automated process, nearly 160,000 text elements in the resolutions were identified as mentions of dates. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_DAT' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same date were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'DAT-annotations' which is described here. The format of the dates is YYYY-DD-MM. 
This dataset excludes both dates that do not refer to another resolution and date mentions that cannot be linked to a specific calendar date.
For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: Standardised version of a date mentioned in the text of the resolutions.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The reference to the exact location of the date-occurrence in the machine readable text of the resolutions.

value.name: descriptionField
value.value: The reference to where, when, how and why the entity-occurrence is extracted.

value.name: description
errordescription
value.value: The entity extraction was performed through an automated process. Therefore, errors may occur. Due to the size of the data, these errors could not be corrected manually.

value.value: Occurrences of entities have been automatically annotated in the text of the resolutions.

value.name: descriptionField
